intro: Metastachys denticulata, commonly known as the toothed beardtongue, is a perennial flowering plant native to the United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, toothed leaves and spires of violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in open woodlands and prairies, where it contributes to local biodiversity. Its unique morphology makes it a valuable addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
